urls.title: EU Datathon 2022
urls.description: The sixth edition of the EU Datathon annual open data competition aims to prove the value of open data and to highlight opportunities for business models using EU institutions and national open data. Participating teams are required to develop mobile or web applications by using open datasets published by EU institutions and/or EU Member States. The EU needs the vision, engagement, and participation of all young people to build a better future that is greener, more inclusive, and digital. Data is at the heart of designing the necessary changes and EU should give incentives to younger generations to use EU data for more innovation in Europe, which is much needed for driving these changes. The EU Datathon is a key EU initiative aiming at creating new value for citizens through innovation and promoting the use of open data produced by the EU institutions. Thus, it can be a major forum for young data talents to display their ideas for shaping the future of the European Union.

#7 Linking #knowledge with #action: Sustainability #transitions requires diverse new knowledge, including evidence about the systems driving environmental pressures, pathways to sustainability, promising initiatives & barriers to change. #SOER2020

#6 Managing risks and ensuring a socially fair and #justtransition: Societies must acknowledge potential risks, opportunities and trade-offs, and devise ways to navigate them. Policies have an essential role in this. #SOER2020

#5 Scaling up #investments and reorienting #finance: Sustainability #transitions will require major investments but Europeans stand to gain hugely ‚Äì both from avoided harms from economic and social opportunities. #SOER2020
#4 Fostering #innovation throughout society: Changing trajectory will depend on the emergence & spread of diverse forms of innovation that can trigger new ways of thinking and living. #SOER2020

#3 Europe cannot achieve sustainability goals alone. The #EU has significant diplomatic & economic influence, which it can use to promote ambitious agreements in #climate, #biodiversity & #resourceuse. #SOER2020
#2 The coverage of long-term policy frameworks needs to be extended to other important systems and issues, starting with the #food system, #chemicals and #LandUse. #SOER2020
#1 Strengthening policy implementation, integration and coherence: Full implementation of existing policies would take #Europe a long way to achieving its environmental goals up to 2030. #SOER2020

#SOER2020 calls for Europe to transform the key societal systems that drive #environment and #climate pressures and #health impacts ‚Äî rethinking not just technologies and production processes but also #consumption patterns and ways of living.
